titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Charles Hill Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Grace Hawes

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-01-18T13:09-0800

change.item: January 2018: Added links to materials from the 2010 October release of U.S. government records and 2017 release of U.S. Government records series that are available on digitalcollections.hoover.org. -Sally DeBauche April 2015: removed Restriction: Boxes 167-169 closed until 2014 September 10. October 2013: Additional increment added January 2011: Additional declassified records added December 2010: Additional declassified records added November 2010: Restriction statement edited and incremental materials added< October 2010: Declassified records series added by Lisa Miller May 2011: Incremental materials added

physdesc.extent: 157 manuscript boxes, 6 oversize boxes, 9 card file boxes, 1 cubic foot box, 2 envelopes

did.abstract: Collection includes correspondence, speeches and writings, dispatches, memoranda, reports, notes, printed matter, memorabilia, and photographs relating to international relations and diplomacy, American foreign policy during the presidential administration of Ronald Reagan, and the Chinese Cultural Revolution. Also contains speeches and writings of Secretary of State George Shultz. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 39-51 closed. The remainder of the collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copiesof audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Charles Hill papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives between 1989 and 2011.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Bridgeton, New Jersey
A.B., Brown University
J.D., University of Pennsylvania
M.A., University of Pennsylvania
Vice Consul, Zurich
Chinese Language Officer, Taichung, Taiwan
Political Officer, Hong Kong
Fellow, East Asia Center, Harvard University
Author, The Cultural Revolution in the Provinces
Mission Coordinator, American Embassy, Saigon, Vietnam
Policy Planning Staff, Department of State
Deputy Director, Israel Desk, Department of State
Political Counselor, American Embassy, Tel Aviv, Israel
Director, Israel and Arab-Israeli Affairs, Department of State
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State, Middle East
Executive Secretary, Department of State
Executive Assistant to the Secretary of State
Diplomat-in-Residence, Stanford University
Senior Research Fellow, Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace
Diplomat-in-Residence and Lecturer in International Studies and Directed Studies, Yale University
Special Advisor to Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali, United Nations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection includes correspondence, speeches and writings, dispatches, memoranda, reports, notes, printed matter, memorabilia, and photographs relating to international relations and diplomacy, American foreign policy during the presidential administration of Ronald Reagan, and the Chinese Cultural Revolution. Also contains speeches and writings of Secretary of State George Shultz.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into series: Biographical File, Correspondence, Speeches and Writings, Subject File, Oversize File, Card File, Stanford Years File, Increments, and Declassified government records.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Career records and biographical data related to Charles Hill's government service, arranged alphabetically by physical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes, drafts, research materials arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Handwritten notes, including notes on China,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, correspondence, charts, maps, outlines, dispatches, reports, press summaries, printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject. Includes notes and speeches by Charles Hill

odd.head: General note
odd.p: See also oversize materials in the Stanford Years File (Box 39)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Certificate of appreciation, Chinese army cap, memorabilia, maps, notebooks of pins, organizational charts.

did.unittitle: Certificate of appreciation from Ronald Reagan for participation in Toronto Summit,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes holograph and typewritten notes on the Cultural Revolution in China, 1967-1968

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches and writings (mostly by others but also by Charles Hill), course notes, subject files related to Charles Hill's work as Diplomat-in-Residence at Stanford University and as Senior Research Fellow at the Hoover Institution, as well as at the United Nations, arranged alphabetically by physical form. The subject file also includes writings by Charles Hill. Includes some earlier material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deposit agreement with the Hoover Institution

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the British and U.S. governments, released in full or in part. Includes some records determined by the government to be unclassified. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder by country of origin, thereunder by date of creation
